content:
About [simple] graphs?

I want something (beginner friendly?) to read through and then slowly formalize, this way becoming acquainted with SimpleGraph part of Mathlib.

Thank you!
This introduction to graph theory looks like it should be good. And it is for free.
Lessness has marked this topic as resolved.

Three good introductions to graph theory from Springer's GTM series are Bollobás (Modern Graph Theory), Bondy and Murty (Graph Theory), and Diestel (Graph Theory). It's worth skimming all three to see which suits you best.
